review: I've owned a V1 Apple TV for several years and loved it. I hung onto it because I thought it was better to be able to download songs / movies to the Hard Drive. I decided to upgrade to the latest edition, and pleased I did. The new Apple TV connects to iPhone / iPad remote control effortlessly. I think you get maximum value if you are also using iTunes match so all your music / videos are available even when your PC is turned off.Great product.
author: TheBritAbroad

review: Apple TV has exceeded all my expections!  Hours and hours of great streaming.  It's so easy to use and right there, 24 hours a day!  I'm going to "cut the cable" to reduce the expense and go with broadcast TV, Netflix, and this little unit!

review: I am an Apple person so it made sense to finally purchase Apple TV. It works great and I'm glad I added it to my collection of Apple products. It makes my movie watching experience effortless.
author: Wanda Marie

review: This little thing is great. I use it in a couple of different ways which I will quickly detail here. 1. I use it to "push" movies from my iPhone and iPad to the TV, things like YouTube and internet videos. 2. I use it to stream movies from my iTunes on my iMac, you must be connected to the same home network for this. 3. I use it to rent movies directly from iTunes (Apple TV app), you must be connected to the internet for this.The only problem I have with it is any movie I get not in Apple format I need to convert and then drag into iTunes. This is a manual workaround but I have it pretty well down to a science by now. Those of you with Macs will want to use the free program called Handbrake and choose one of the pre-set AppleTV conversions, I currently have been using the AppleTV3 conversion pre-set and everything is great!
author: B. Briggs "talktob"

author: Carlos Brana

review: I have owned several Apple TVs of all three generations, I have loved the concept from the very beginning. This device is the reason that I don't pay cable TV, just a very fast internet connection plus Netflix, iTunes etc. This third generation goes all the way to full 1080p HD resolution and costs less than half what the first edition cost - and it is so much more capable. My only wish for improvement is for Apple to find a way to offer channel based TV subscriptions, it would be fantastic to put together your own lineup and pay accordingly. It's simply amazing what a small box for less than a hundred bucks can do. I have yet to come across someone who doesn't enjoy using an Apple TV. There's one on every single TV in my household.
author: C. Wolters
